SEARCH
Package sustech.cs304.utils

Class FileUtils

java.lang.Object
sustech.cs304.utils.FileUtils
public class FileUtils extends Object
Utility class for various file-related operations such as extracting file names, extensions, handling dotfiles, modifying environment variable files, and determining application data storage paths across operating systems.

  • Method Details

    • getFileName

      public static String getFileName(String path)
      Returns the file name from a given path.
      Parameters:
      path - the full file path
      Returns:
      the file name portion of the path

    • getExtension

      public static String getExtension(File file)
      Returns the file extension of the provided File.
      Parameters:
      file - the file to extract extension from
      Returns:
      the file extension (without dot), or an empty string if none exists

    • ifDotFile

      public static boolean ifDotFile(File file)
      Checks if the given File is a dotfile (starts with a '.').
      Parameters:
      file - the file to check
      Returns:
      true if the file is a dotfile, false otherwise

    • modifyEnvFile

      public static void modifyEnvFile(String key, String value)
      Modifies or appends a key-value pair in a .env file located at the application root. If the key exists, its value is replaced; otherwise, the key-value pair is added.
      Parameters:
      key - the environment variable key
      value - the value to set for the key

    • getEnvValue

      public static String getEnvValue(String key)
      Retrieves the value of a specified environment variable from the .env file. If the key does not exist, returns null.
      Parameters:
      key - the environment variable key to look for
      Returns:
      the value associated with the key, or null if not found

    • getAppDataPath

      public static Path getAppDataPath()
      Returns the path to the application's data directory, based on the OS. Creates the directory if it does not exist.
      • Windows: %USER_HOME%\AppData\Roaming\AIDE
      • macOS: %USER_HOME%/Library/Application Support/AIDE
      • Linux/other: %USER_HOME%/.AIDE
      Returns:
      the Path object for the app data directory
